biography.value:
Daemogoth titans are towering monsters that blight the land around them. A daemogoth grows in power over the course of decades spent feeding on sorrow and draining life from nature. Eventually that growth turns the daemogoth into a titan.

The titans maintain their lesser cousins’ ability to trade magical power for a mortal’s pain, but they tend to demand more punishing suffering in exchange for their pacts or knowledge.

Barbed Gifts

When a supplicant piques a daemogoth titan’s interest, the titan can grant a blessing to the supplicant (see “Supernatural Gifts” in the Dungeon Master’s Guide). As long as the creature has the blessing, it must expend and roll two of its Hit Dice whenever it finishes a long rest. It takes psychic damage equal to the total rolled, and its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the psychic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes its next long rest. The creature dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The blessing can be removed only by a wish spell.

description.value:
The titan makes two Agonizing Burst attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +12 to hit, reach 15 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 3d6 + @mod type=force average=true]] damage. If the target is a creature, the titan regains [[/damage 5 type=heal average=false]] hit points.

The [[lookup @name]] casts [[lookup @item.name]].

The titan teleports to an unoccupied space it can see within 120 feet of itself.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The titan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The titan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Attack. The titan makes one Agonizing Burst attack.

Stalking Nightmare (Costs 2 Actions). The titan uses Teleport, after which it can target one creature within 20 feet of itself that it can see. The target must make a [[/save con 20 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 4d10 type=necrotic average=true]] damage, and the titan regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the titan doesn’t heal.

Terrorize (Costs 3 Actions). The titan targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a [[/save wis 20 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 7d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage and is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the titan until the end of the target’s next turn, and the titan regains 15 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn’t &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, and the titan doesn’t heal.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The titan makes one Agonizing Burst attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The titan uses Teleport, after which it can target one creature within 20 feet of itself that it can see. The target must make a [[/save con 20 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 4d10 type=necrotic average=true]] damage, and the titan regains [[/damage 10 type=heal average=false]] hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and the titan doesn’t heal.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The titan targets one creature it can see within 120 feet of itself. The target must make a [[/save wis 20 format=long]]. On a failed save, the target takes [[/damage 7d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage and is &Reference[frightened]{frightened} of the titan until the end of the target’s next turn, and the titan regains [[/damage 15 type=heal average=false]] hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn’t &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, and the titan doesn’t heal.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Pact of Suffering. Using a 10-minute long &Reference[ritual]{ritual}, the titan can forge a magical bond with a willing creature it touches throughout the &Reference[ritual]{ritual}. The creature becomes bound by the pact until it dies, the titan dies, or the pact is broken by a wish spell.

The titan chooses one spell from the &Reference[nec]{necromancy} or &Reference[enc]{enchantment} school that is 8th level or lower. The bound creature can cast that spell using this pact, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[int]{Intelligence} as the spellcasting ability. When it casts the spell, the creature takes [[/damage 6d6 type=psychic average=true]] damage, which can’t break the creature’s &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on a spell. Once the bound creature casts the spell in this way, it can’t do so again until it finishes a long rest.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
